New Records: Dominik Szoboszlai scored twice, once in the first half and once via a penalty in the second half, earning him a man of the match rating of 8.8.
Hungary achieved a 2-0 victory, extending their dominance over Bosnia and Herzegovina in the Nations League.
Key Match Events: Hungary scored their first goal through Dominik Szoboszlai in the 21st minute.
Bosnia was reduced to 10 men after Nail Omerovic's reckless challenge, resulting in a penalty and a yellow card.
Edin Dzeko had several chances but was unlucky not to score.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Sergej Barbarez was critical of the team's defensive performance and missed chances.
Hungary's manager Marco Rossi praised the team's performance and tactics.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Hungary's second consecutive win in the Nations League against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Player statistics like pass accuracy and key passes were mentioned but didn't fall into a specific category.
